utils

Class FileHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.FileHandler

  • public class FileHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Takes a text file and reads it. If it's null it throws an exception and terminates the program. Also, it reads every single line and stops when it finds a null one.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileHandler(java.lang.String path)
      Reads a file and if it's unable to open it, it throws an exception, prints a message and exits the program.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void clearFile(java.lang.String path)
      Method to overwrite the file with a blank file.

      Returns the file name without the extension
      static java.io.File[] getFiles(java.lang.String dir)
      Returns a list of all the files in a directory.
      boolean hasNext()
      Checks if the reader is at the end of file.
      java.lang.String nextLine()
      Reads every line of the file.

      Method to return a string array of all lines in the file.
      static void writeFile(java.lang.String path, java.lang.Object o, boolean append)
      Overloaded method of writeFile where it can take any object and write the line to the file.

      Method to save a file to a certain path and specific lines to write.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileHandler

        public FileHandler(java.lang.String path)
        Reads a file and if it's unable to open it, it throws an exception, prints a message and exits the program.
        Parameters:
        path - The local path of that file.

    • Method Detail

      • nextLine

        public java.lang.String nextLine()
        Reads every line of the file. If it finds an empty line it returns empty "".
        Returns:
        Returns the line of the file or an empty String.

      • readLines

        public java.lang.String[] readLines()
        Method to return a string array of all lines in the file.
        Returns:
        String array consisting of every line in the file.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Checks if the reader is at the end of file.
        Returns:
        false if reader has reached the end of the file.

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile(java.lang.String path,
                             java.lang.String[] lines,
                             boolean append)
        Method to save a file to a certain path and specific lines to write.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file being created/written to
        lines - the lines of text to be written in the file
        append - Boolean value if true will append to file, otherwise overwrite the file.

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile(java.lang.String path,
                             java.lang.Object o,
                             boolean append)
        Overloaded method of writeFile where it can take any object and write the line to the file.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file being created/written to
        o - the object which will be written using o.toString()
        append - Boolean value if true will append to file, otherwise overwrite the file.

      • clearFile

        public static void clearFile(java.lang.String path)
        Method to overwrite the file with a blank file.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file to be overwritten.

      • getFiles

        public static java.io.File[] getFiles(java.lang.String dir)
        Returns a list of all the files in a directory.
        Parameters:
        dir - String path to the directory
        Returns:
        Array of files inside dir.

      • getFileName

        public static java.lang.String getFileName(java.io.File f)
        Returns the file name without the extension
        Parameters:
        f - The File passed to determine the file name
        Returns:
        The fileName split with . to return the filename without extension.
